text:
Pardon me if its a niche question,
I often see `...` in many places in Julia
What do those mean?

elements.text:
Pardon me if its a niche question,
I often see

in many places in Julia
What do those mean?

text:
```help?> ...
search: ...

  ...

  The "splat" operator, ..., represents a sequence of arguments. ... can be used in function definitions, to indicate
  that the function accepts an arbitrary number of arguments. ... can also be used to apply a function to a sequence
  of arguments.

  Examples
  ≡≡≡≡≡≡≡≡≡≡

  julia> add(xs...) = reduce(+, xs)
  add (generic function with 1 method)

  julia> add(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
  15

  julia> add([1, 2, 3]...)
  6

  julia> add(7, 1:100..., 1000:1100...)
  111107```

  that the function accepts an arbitrary number of arguments. ... can also be used to apply a function to a sequence

  Examples
  ≡≡≡≡≡≡≡≡≡≡

  julia> add(xs...) = reduce(+, xs)
  add (generic function with 1 method)

  julia> add(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
  15

  julia> add([1, 2, 3]...)
  6

  julia> add(7, 1:100..., 1000:1100...)
  111107

text: I didn't even think of doing that....

text:
There is a nice example of that syntax at
<https://twitter.com/milankloewer/status/1370081555566235649>
and Henrideh explains it at the end (post 71) of <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/seven-lines-of-julia-examples-sought/50416/68>
